purpose.para: This macro is used to register a typedef, which is defined in the global scope, with the Mirror library. After successful registration the type can be reflected. This macro is equivalent to the BOOST_MIRROR_REG_TYPEDEF_GLOBAL_SCOPE macro.

description.para: The BOOST_MIRROR_REG_TYPEDEF_GS macro registers a global scope typedef with the Mirror library.

To register a typedef defined in a named namespace use the BOOST_MIRROR_REG_TYPEDEF. To register a (regular i.e. not typedef'd) type, use one of the BOOST_MIRROR_REG_TYPE_GLOBAL_SCOPE, BOOST_MIRROR_REG_TYPE_GS or BOOST_MIRROR_REG_TYPE macros. To register a type which is defined inside of a class use either the BOOST_MIRROR_REG_TYPE_EMBEDDED or the BOOST_MIRROR_REG_TYPE_EMB macro.
description.note: The registering must be done in the ::boost::mirror namespace.
description.para: The only argument is the name of the typedef to be registered.
